page.title: 08ADDINGTON VILLAGE TODAY
page.content: There has probably been a{SETTLEMENT on the site of Addington Village since {ANGLO-SAXON}times.This is suggested by the place-name ending "ton" which is of Anglo-Saxon origin. It is interesting to note that the older buildings in the village including the church and the old smithy are located on Addington Village road while the new houses have been built behind. Addington Village road was once the main road from the area into Kent but since the 1960's when a new by-pass was built it is now a cul-de-sac.Most of the newer buildings in the village have been built within the last 20 years and now make up most of what was once a quiet little village. Although there is a main road running through the village up spout hill it is still
